headline.print_headline: Jamaica Turns Back U.S. In First of Two Qualifiers
headline.seo: Jamaica Turns Back U.S. in First of Two World Cup Qualifiers
headline.main: Jamaica Turns Back U.S. in First of Two Qualifiers

docs.snippet: Despite taking a lead in the first minute of play, the United States lost to Jamaica in a sloppy match at National Stadium in Kingston, Jamaica....
docs.abstract: Jamaica defeats the United States men's soccer team, 2-1, in World Cup qualifier.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite taking a lead in the first minute of play, the United States lost to Jamaica in a sloppy match at National Stadium in Kingston, Jamaica.

headline.print_headline: Pitchers’ Duel Ends Abruptly With Tampa Bay Home Run
headline.main: Pitchers’ Duel Ends Abruptly With Tampa Bay Home Run

docs.snippet: Amid speculation that John Farrell could be considered to take over the Red Sox if Bobby Valentine is let go, the Blue Jays skipper said before Friday’s game he was concentrating on his current job....
docs.abstract: MLB Roudup; Tampa Bay Rays defeat the Texas Rangers, 3-1, in 11 innings; other baseball scores noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amid speculation that John Farrell could be considered to take over the Red Sox if Bobby Valentine is let go, the Blue Jays skipper said before Friday’s game he was concentrating on his current job.

headline.print_headline: Mets Honor a Longtime Rival, Who Returns the Love
headline.seo: Mets Honor Rival Chipper Jones, Who Returns the Love
headline.main: Mets Honor a Longtime Rival, Who Returns the Love

docs.snippet: Chipper Jones, who made a career out of pounding Mets pitching, reflects on the Mets and their fans in his farewell visit to Queens....
docs.abstract: Atlanta Braves defeat New York Mets, 3-0; Mets fans salute Braves third baseman Chipper Jones, who is retiring at season's end.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chipper Jones, who made a career out of pounding Mets pitching, reflects on the Mets and their fans in his farewell visit to Queens.

headline.print_headline: As a Coolant Is Phased Out, Smugglers Reap Big Profits
headline.seo: Smugglers Sell Coolant Tied to Global Warming
headline.main: As Coolant Is Phased Out, Smugglers Reap Large Profits

docs.snippet: As government authorities in the industrialized world work to phase out an air-conditioner coolant, HCFC-22, a black market has sprung up for it....
docs.abstract: Enormous black market has sprung up for HCFC-22, coolant gas used in air conditioners that was banned under the terms of an international treaty because it contributes to global warming; gas is still produced in enormous volumes and sold cheaply in China, India, Mexico and elsewhere, making it a profitable if unlikely commodity for international smugglers (Series: Chilling Effect).

byline.original: By ELISABETH ROSENTHAL and ANDREW W. LEHREN

docs.lead_paragraph: As government authorities in the industrialized world work to phase out an air-conditioner coolant, HCFC-22, a black market has sprung up for it.

headline.print_headline: Private Sector Role Is at Heart of Campaigns’ Split on College Costs
headline.seo: 2 Campaigns Diverge on Confronting Rising Cost of College
headline.main: Private Sector Role Is at Heart of Campaigns’ Split on College Costs

docs.snippet: While President Obama would work to increase grants and extend a tax credit, Mitt Romney would work to make financial aid available for students who “need it most,” an aide said....
docs.abstract: Pres Obama and Mitt Romney are offering voters vastly different solutions to the problem of the rising cost of college tuition; Obama would work to increase grants and extend a tax credit, while Romney's policy proposals reflect his desire to reduce federal spending and to shift more government functions to the private sector.
docs.lead_paragraph: While President Obama would work to increase grants and extend a tax credit, Mitt Romney would work to make financial aid available for students who “need it most,” an aide said.

headline.print_headline: Yanks, Behind Three Homers, Knock Orioles Back Down
headline.seo: Yankees, Behind Three Homers, Knock Orioles Back Down to Second Place
headline.main: Yanks, Behind Three Homers, Knock Orioles Back Down

docs.snippet: Home runs from Russell Martin, Steve Pearce and Alex Rodriguez accounted for all but one of the Yankees’ runs as they again moved a game ahead of Baltimore in the American League East race....
docs.abstract: New York Yankees defeat Baltimore Orioles, 8-5, to regain first place in the American League East.
docs.lead_paragraph: Home runs from Russell Martin, Steve Pearce and Alex Rodriguez accounted for all but one of the Yankees’ runs as they again moved a game ahead of Baltimore in the American League East race.

headline.print_headline: Islamic Poultry for Latino Tables (Yes, They Have Chilies, Too)
headline.seo: In East Los Angeles, the Butchers Are Muslim and the Customers Latino
headline.main: Islamic Poultry for Latino Tables (Yes, They Have Chilies, Too)

docs.snippet: A halal butcher in East Los Angeles expected patronage by fellow Muslims. Latino immigrants became its customers instead, making for some admirable cultural interaction....
docs.abstract: Al Salam Polleria, a family-owned halal poultry butcher in Los Angeles, was initially opened to serve Muslims in the community, but its patrons have turned out to largely be Latino immigrants.
docs.lead_paragraph: A halal butcher in East Los Angeles expected patronage by fellow Muslims. Latino immigrants became its customers instead, making for some admirable cultural interaction.

headline.print_headline: A Walmart for Chinatown Stirs a Fight in Los Angeles
headline.main: A Walmart for Chinatown Stirs a Fight in Los Angeles

docs.snippet: Some local residents and business owners fear this historic immigrant community is now threatened by the newest big-box addition to the neighborhood....
docs.abstract: Residents and business owners in Chinatown in Los Angeles fear that the historic immigrant community is threatened by the planned construction of a Walmart; since the company announced its plans to build a store in the neighborhood where small businesses have thrived for more than 70 years, a furious battle has broken out over the project.
docs.lead_paragraph: Some local residents and business owners fear this historic immigrant community is now threatened by the newest big-box addition to the neighborhood.
